(20) Y^a rip-tak y^a isi-p-ida. · Their analysis in sum: ­da/wa­ verbalize (intransitive) roots (inchoativizers), while
1sing.obj cold-3sing.ds 1sing.obj shudder-pa-3sing.past ­ta/pa­ transitivize (already verbalized) intransitive stems (transitivizers).
(20) Y^a rip-tak y^a isi-p-ida. · Their analysis in sum: ­da/wa­ verbalize (intransitive) roots (inchoativizers), while
1sing.obj cold-3sing.ds 1sing.obj shudder-pa-3sing.past ­ta/pa­ transitivize (already verbalized) intransitive stems (transitivizers).
Y^a rip-tak y^a isi-p-ida. · Their analysis in sum: ­da/wa­ verbalize (intransitive) roots (inchoativizers), while
1sing.obj cold-3sing.ds 1sing.obj shudder-pa-3sing.past ­ta/pa­ transitivize (already verbalized) intransitive stems (transitivizers).
(23) a. Kimby ya madi laih babar-p-ida.
· This revised analysis has ramifications for Hale and Keyser's theory of argument struc-
ture, which Ulwa verb morphology had previously been taken as evidence for. Further
